newsitem.title: MEXICO: Journalist murdered in trouble-torn Mexican state.
newsitem.headline: Journalist murdered in trouble-torn Mexican state.

text.p: A Mexican journalist, his body riddled with bullets, was found dead on Thursday on a road alongside his fire-damaged car, a regional branch of the National Union of Journalists (SNRP) said.

Jesus Bueno Leon, a director at the regional weekly Siete Dias, was found dead on a rural road close to the city of Chilpancingo some 120 miles (200 km) south of Mexico City, the Guerrero SNRP branch said in a statement.
Chilpancingo is the state capital of Guerrero, a trouble-torn southern state with guerrilla activity, widespread kidnappings and frequent political and social unrest.
The National Union of Journalists said two months ago its members asked state Gov. Angel Aguirre to protect Bueno Leon after the journalist had received death threats.
Guerrero state government officials were not immediately available for comment.
Journalists plan a protest march on Friday to call for an immediate investigation into the killing.
